page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{The Legend of St. Cuthbert & Holywell}
Recorded in the Domesday of lO86 as Chenowen, the name Cubert originates from the Saxon Cuth-bert meaning knowledge, wisdom and understanding. Several legends exist about the origin of both Cubert and Holywell, but the most popular tells how in 955 AD the relics of St. Cuthbert (Bishop) were being taken to Ireland by the monks of Durham as they fled from the invading Danes. A storm drove them onto the Cornish Coast at Holywell. It is said from the moment the relics rested on the rocks the well immediately had healing qualities. In memory of their being saved the monks are said to have built the original church and given it its name.
